sect1:
Hg
Class Summary VersionControl_Hg
Base class to begin the fluent API
Base class to begin the fluent API
This package interfaces with the Mercurial command-line binary, which must be installed on the same system as this package. The author of Mercurial is on record preferring that all non-python programs interface with the CLI binary.
There are no C-bindings, so a PECL extension is unlikely, as is a pure PHP implementation due to the tremendous workload involved in keeping up with changes Mercurial.
Usage:
require_once 'VersionControl/Hg.php'; $hg = new VersionControl_Hg('/path/to/repository');
Setting the repository also automatically finds and sets the local path of the Mercurial binary it will use.
Of course, you may explicitly set the executable you wish to use:
$hg->setExecutable('/path/to/hg');
or
$hg->executable = '/path/to/hg';
A failed explicit setting will not clear the automatically set executable.
You may also provide a location of a repository after instantiation:
require_once 'VersionControl/Hg.php'; $hg = new VersionControl_Hg(); $hg->setRepository('/path/to/repository');
or
$hg->repository = '/path/to/repository';
Calling all commands other than 'version' without having already set a valid repository will raise an exception.
PHP version 5

Class Summary VersionControl_Hg_Command_Add
Add file(s) to a repository
Add file(s) to a repository
Usage:
$hg = new VersionControl_Hg('/path/to/repo'); $hg->add('foo.txt')->run(); or $hg->add(array('foo.txt','bar.txt'))->run(); or $hg->add()->files(array('foo.txt'))->run(); or $hg->add()->excluding('**.txt')->run();
Should return a list of files added.

$hg = new VersionControl_Hg('/path/to/repo'); $hg->diff('git'|'gnu')->files(array('index.php', 'default.html')) ->between('tip'|'2011-04-11'|'working-copy|')->revision(22)|->date('2011-03-01');
</code>
Should return a list of files added.

Class Summary VersionControl_Hg_Command_Log
Implements the log command.
Implements the log command.
The hg command-line client also uses 'history' as an alias. *
include_once 'VersionControl/Hg.php'; $hg = new VersionControl_Hg('/path/to/repository'); $hg->log()->run('verbose');
Show only log entries for the following dates:
$hg->log()->on('Dec 27, 2010')->run(); $hg->log()->before('Dec 27, 2010')->run(); $hg->log()->after('Dec 27, 2010')->run(); $hg->log()->between('Dec 27, 2010', '2010-12-31')->run();
Show only log entries for revision 2:
$hg->log()->revision('2')->format('raw')->run('verbose'); $hg->log()->revision('2')->run('verbose');
Show only log entries for specific files:
$hg->log()->files(array('index.php'))->run();
Exclude log entries for certain files:
$hg->log()->excluding('**.php')->run();
This displays nothing; excluding takes precedence. Remove excluding() to get only index.php:
$hg->log()->files(array('index.php'))->excluding('**.php')->run();
Include specific files, which might not show up otherwise. Using this with files can lead to unexpected results:
$hg->log()->including('**.php')->run();
Patching and diffing options are not available in this class as they might be when using the command line Mercurial client.

Class Summary VersionControl_Hg_Container_Repository_Revision
Composes a revision object for use in commands
Composes a revision object for use in commands
Rewrite some commands to accept a VersionControl_Hg_Container_Repository_Revision
Usage:
$hg = new VersionControl_Hg('/path/to/repo'); $revision = $hg->get()->revision('22')->run(); $revision = $hg->revision('22')->run(); But, do what?
$revision = $hg->revision('22'); $log = $hg->log($revision)->run(); Which is equivelent to $log = $hg->log()->revision('22')->run(); or $revision = $hg->revision('3bcf453face889')->get()->run();
